document.content: Nielsen Case Competition 2015. We only have more than one week to register for Nielsen Case Competition 2015. Hurry up students! Approved team submissions will be selected based on below criteria: â€¢ Group of 4 members â€¢ Academic result: above 6.5 â€¢ English score: TOEIC 700+ or IELTS 6.0+ (no band below 6.0) or equivalent is preferred â€¢ Your social activities participation is preferred Submission deadline: October 16, 2015. For more details, please download the regulation here http://bit.ly/1GvHvqj For more details, email us at Ncc.Vietnam@nielsen.com.

document.label: foreign language
document.content: NIELSEN CASE COMPETITION 2015. NOW OPEN FOR REGISTRATION! To students from FPT, UEL (University of Economics and Law), HSU (Hoa Sen University), ERC, RMIT, UEH (University of Economics) and UEF (University of Economics and Finance), IU (International University) universities, please contact your local faculty members for more details and registrations. To all students from other universities (both HCMC and Hanoi), simply email your latest team score sheet and teamâ€™s resume to Ncc.Vietnam@nielsen.com. Approved team submissions will be selected based on below criteria: â€¢ Group of 4 members â€¢ Academic result: above 6.5 â€¢ English score: TOEIC 700+ or IELTS 6.0+ (no band below 6.0) or equivalent is preferred â€¢ Your social activities participation is preferred Submission deadline: By October 16, 2015. Next step: Team interview will be conducted in the week of October 19, 2015. Only selected teams will be contacted for the teamâ€™s interview. Results will be announced on October 23, 2015. Required document submission: â€¢ Resume of 4 members in the team â€¢ Score sheet of each team member â€¢ English certificate (if any) â€¢ Certificates of participation in social activities (if any) For more details, please download the regulation here http://bit.ly/1QMdh7W

document.label: foreign language
document.content: Lotte Coralis Vietnam - investor of Lotte Center Hanoi s currently launching RECEPTIONIST vacancy for potential candidates: I. RESPONSIBILITIES - Meeting and greeting customers, tenants and members of the public - Answering and forwarding phone calls - Directing visitors to their destinations - Deliver excellent customer service at all times - To update the shift diary during and at the end of shift detailing all important activities carried out. - Display excellent knowledge about the building and the surrounding area - Dealing with complaints or problems and reporting to management immediately - Report any maintenance issues immediately to line manager. - Deal with all enquiries in a professional and courteous manner whether in person - Fulfill all reasonable requests from guests to ensure their comfort, satisfaction and safety - Be responsible for evacuation, in cases of emergency, acting as first point of contact for guests and emergency services - Carry out instructions when given by management and head office - To be punctual and maintain a professional appearance and adhere to uniform policy - To priority tasks in relevance of importance * Working place: Lotte Coralis Vietnam Office â€“ Floor 13, Lotte Center Hanoi, 54 Lieu Giai, Cong Vá»‹, Ba Dinh * Working time: Full - time 44 hour/week, according to work requirement employee may work by shift. (Admin shift: 8:30 â€“ 17:30, morning shift: 7:00 - 15:00, afternoon shift: 11:00 â€“ 19:00) * Benefit: â€¢ Competitive salary, enjoy the same benefit and welfare for official employees of Lotte Coralis Vietnam such as: periodical health check, team-building, annual leave, gifts for holidays,â€¦ â€¢ Sufficient Insurance: Social Insurance, Health Insurance, Unemployment Insurance, Bao Viet 24h Insurance (100% paid by company) â€¢ Parking Allowance, Meal Allowance. II. REQUIREMENT - Education: Bachelor degree or higher in related field preferred. - Experience: Experience in guest services preferred - Female preferred - Fluent spoken and written English - Good appearance and grooming - Must show basic computer and electronics proficiency such as with MS Word - Knowledge about Opera PMS system and POS, EDC payment is a plus - Ability to work in shift (morning, afternoon, night) and long hours Others: - A PHOTO OF CANDIDATE IS REQUIRED TO BE ATTACHED IN THE CV

All Acting:) I really want to bring advanced and working actors all together, to create a safe environment for actors to learn new tools, be inspired, and share ideas to sharpen and improve their craft. document.label: foreign language
document.content: Instagram user @ayujuz submitted this picture of Bangkok's Wat Traimit. It's a nice temple, built to house a single Buddha statue...and it's the story of the statue that's really amazing. In 1801 King Rama I ordered Buddha images from around the country be used to populate temples in the new capital of Bangkok. A large, heavy plaster Buddha from the former capital of Ayutthaya was one of them. In 1954, a crane moving the statue to make way for some construction broke. The statue fell and cracked, revealing that the plaster was merely covering the true Buddha image - one made out of gold! It's 3m tall and weighs 5.5 tons. The statue has been dated to the 13th or 14th century, and was probably covered up with plaster to prevent looters from melting it down. Over many years it was forgotten about, until that fateful day in 1954.

document.label: foreign language
document.content: Traditionally known for being KLâ€™s red light district, Chow Kit is not a typical tourist stop. While the cheap hotels acting as fronts for prostitution from the 70s and 80s are gone, Chow Kitâ€™s shady reputation still lingers till today. It is a neighborhood that is as unrefined as it is intriguing, with plenty of character and some hidden gems for adventurous travelers to discover.

document.label: foreign language
document.content: "Thereâ€™s a Filipino superstition that says if you have a mole on your feet - which I do - you canâ€™t stay in one place. I guess itâ€™s true. I also like the concept of moving, going forward. It opens your mind, teaches you new things. Iâ€™m able to find beauty even in chaos, and love discovering the charms of a destination even if theyâ€™re not obvious." Follow @charanoid on Instagram for more great photos
